info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 24 at 12:00PM CST until December 27 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...In Kansas, Decatur and Norton Counties. In Nebraska, Red Willow County. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Strong north winds will be present through Wednesday. New snowfall is forecast to start Monday evening and persist through the day Tuesday; snow may be heavy at times. North winds gusting 45-55 mph are expected resulting in near blizzard to blizzard conditions. If traveling after the Christmas holiday continue to check back for the most up to date forecast..
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
